title: America's first waterpark has been empty for 13 years | Daily Mail ... - Daily Mail
text: How America's first waterpark dried up: Pioneering attraction in the California desert has been standing empty for 13 years Lake Dolores waterpark, in Newbury Springs, California, was first opened in 1962 by businessman Bob Byers The park, situated between Los Angeles and Las Vegas, operated intermittently until 2004 Today, many of the water slides and attractions are gone, having been sold as piecemeal Much of what's left in the park has been torn apart by people salvaging metal and wires Published: 12:25 GMT, 13 March 2017 | Updated: 16:28 GMT, 13 March 2017 67 shares
